info.name: Police Scorecard API
info.description: Local Developer API Support for Police Scorecard Platform.

item.name: API Access

request.description:
You will not be able to make a request to our API without a `token` sent in an
Authorization Header.  This `/token` endpoint is the only public endpoint open to
allow a `token` to be requested.  This endpoint is only required for anonymous users
that have not logged in.  Once the user logs in, you will need to use the `token` that
is sent back for that user, as it will be used for authenticating that specific user.

Once a user has logged in, you will need to send over their Authentication
Token in the HTTP Header.  A `token` is returned with a successful login.  A session
token is valid for 7 days.  You can refresh your token to prevent having to log in
again by either adding the Request Authorization Header below, or using the
`/api/0.1/user/refresh/` endpoint.

header.description: This will likely return `Invalid or expired token` unless you put in a fresh token that is connected to an actual user account ( not an anonymous account )

request.description:
A `token` is returned with a successful login.  A session token is valid for 7 days.
You can refresh your token to prevent having to log in again by either adding the
Request Authorization Header below. `token` should be the string returned in the
`token` parameter from a successful login.

item.description: All access to our API will require an Authentication Token. The following endpoint will get your access to endpoints that do not require user authentication.

request.description:
API Endpoint to register new users. This should set the user's `activated` field
to `true` unless they've included their email address. If so, `activated` is
`false` and the user will be sent an email with a `new_email_key` key to confirm
their email address to complete registration.

(required, string) - Current Account Password ( required to make any changes on this endpoint )
(optional, string) - New Username user wishes to change their username to
(optional, string) - New Email Address user wishes to associate with their account
(optional, string) - New Password user wishes to use for their account
(optional, string) - Repeat the new password to make sure they match so they don't get locked out

request.description:
This endpoint will allow the logged in user to update their own account.  This uses the current Authentication Bearer Token to lookup who's account to update.

The Bearer Token is created during login and contains the users ID from our database.  You will not be able to use this endpoint to manage anyone elses account except your own.

IMPORTANT NOTES ABOUT THIS ENDPOINT:

1. Changing the username will immediately make the old username available to the world for use.  We do check to make sure that the new username being requested is available.

2. We do not immediately change the email when requested.  Instead we send a confirmation email to both the new and old email to confirm the requested change.

3. We do not immediately change the password when requested.  We first send a confirmation email to the users current email to confirm that they made the requested change.

response.name: Response 200

urlencoded.description: (required, string) - Current Account Username ( required to make any changes on this endpoint )
(required, string) - Current Account Password ( required to make any changes on this endpoint )
(optional, string) - New Username user wishes to change their username to
(optional, string) - New Email Address user wishes to associate with their account
(optional, string) - New Password user wishes to use for their account

item.description: The following endpoints for accessing & managing settings for the current logged in user.  These endpoints only work for the user associated with the Authorization Bearer Token sent in the header.  This uses the current Authentication Bearer Token to lookup who's account to update. The Bearer Token is created during login and contains the users ID from our database.  You will not be able to use this endpoint to manage anyone elses account except your own.
